algorithm_technique: Iterate through linked list, use hash set for O(1) value lookup to remove nodes.
problem_summary_simple: Remove nodes from a linked list if their values are in a given array.
problem_summary_technical: Traverse linked list, using a hash set for efficient lookup of values to be deleted.
key_insights: Using a hash set (lookup) for the array elements allows for O(1) average time complexity for checking if a node's value needs to be deleted.
A dummy node simplifies handling the head of the linked list, especially when the head itself needs to be removed.
The `curr` pointer always points to the node *before* the one being checked, allowing for easy modification of `curr.next`.
